Standard Operating Procedure: Data Handling

GENERAL REQUIREMENTS

1. All data must be classified before processing according to the
organization's data classification framework.

(a) Public data requires no special handling beyond standard
operating procedures.

(b) Internal data requires access controls and audit logging.

(c) Confidential data requires encryption at rest and in transit.

(i) At rest encryption shall use industry-standard algorithms
with a minimum key length of 256 bits.

(ii) In transit encryption shall use current transport layer
security protocols.

(iii) Key management shall follow established key rotation
schedules as defined by the security team.

2. Data retention periods shall be established for all categories
of data processed by the organization.

(a) Transactional data shall be retained for seven years.

(b) Customer communications shall be retained for three years.

(c) Internal operational data shall be retained for one year.

ACCESS CONTROL

3. Access shall be granted on a need-to-know basis following the
principle of least privilege.

(a) Read access may be granted to authorized personnel within
the relevant business unit.

(b) Write access requires approval from the data steward and
the relevant department manager.

(c) Administrative access requires approval from the chief
information security officer.

4. Access reviews shall be conducted quarterly to ensure compliance
with the principle of least privilege.

DATA TRANSFER

5. Cross-border data transfers require a documented legal basis
and appropriate safeguards.

(a) Transfers within the organization require a data transfer
agreement approved by legal counsel.

(b) Transfers to third parties require a data processing agreement
and evidence of adequate security controls.

6. Data transfers shall be logged and auditable for a minimum period
of three years from the date of transfer.

"Confidential data" means any data classified as confidential under
the organization's data classification framework.

"Data steward" means the individual designated as responsible for
the governance of a specific dataset.

"Authorized personnel" means employees who have been granted access
through the formal access request process.
